text: sup you beautiful bastards, hope you're having a fantastic tuesday , welcome back to the Phillip Defranco Show and lets just jump into it.

And if your unfamiliar with them, Charlie Kirk is the founder and president of Turning Point USA, and Candace Owens is the communications director for that same organization.
And as far as what that company is: it is a conservative non profit, primarily aimed at students.
and the reason we're talking about them today, is that yesterday they were in Philadelphia, specifically they were trying to eat at Green Eggs Cafe

And then in a quickie, but also interesting update around the James Gunn, Guardians of The Galaxy Vol. 3 situation
The director of Guardians of the Galaxy, James Gunn was of course fired by disney
because of old tweets
and where we ended up leaving this story was when the guardians of the galaxy cast released a statement together
and since then, even with the cast speaking out, or the fans saying that they want James Gunn rehired
reports have said it is incredibly unlikely that Disney would actually do so
and the reason we're talking about this today is the actor who plays Drax in Guardians of the Galaxy Dave Bautista
he has not only remained independently outspoken about this topic
he's saying he might not even be in the next movie
I mean on August 5th we saw him tweet:

I will do what I'm legally obligated to do, but Guardians without James Gunn is not what I signed up for. Guardians of the Galaxy with out James Gunn just isn't Guardians of the Galaxy. It's also pretty nauseating to work for someone who'd empower a smear campaign by #cybernazis. Thats just how i feel.
and then in a recent interview with Shortlist, he said:  Nobody is defending his tweets, but this was a smear campaign on good man.
I spoke to Chris Pratt the day after it happened,and he's a bit religious so he wanted time to pray and figure it out.
but I was more like fuck this. This is bullshit. James is one of the most kindest, most decent people I've met.
Where I'm at right now is that if Marvel doesn't use that script, then I'm going to ask them to release me from my contract, cut me out or recast me.
I'd be doing James a disservice if I didn't.
And I'd have to say between that statement and the tweet on Aug.5th
I have to imagine if they do not bring back James Gunn
Which once again does not seem likely
I have to imagine Disney will also want to replace Bautista.

And then lets talk about a story that's starts with what I was going to include in Today in awesome
that being every now and then I recommend a really good show, or movie, or video game
and i was going to recommend the game: Dead Cells
and actually I still do recommend the game Dead Cells
it just came out, and if you cant tell from the luggage underneath my eyes
I woke up at 2:00am in the morning for some reason, could not go back to sleep
ended up just picking this up
and playing for five hours
it is fantastic
but the reason I'm not including it Today In Awesome
it is actually apart of a big story and controversy.
the reason for that, IGN reviewed this game
they gave it a 9.7
no real big news there
and the review was by Nintendo editior at IGN Filip Miucin
and the story should have ended there, that is until a channel by the name of Boomstick Gaming uploaded a video claiming that IGN copied them.
and in this video Boomstick gaming does this back to back, compare and contrast between the two videos.
and the big note here is Boomstick Gaming was released July 24th
and IGN''s was released August 6th
and let's showcase two of the highlights
and following this video blowing up
IGN has responded and pulled there review, and in it's place there is a editors note that reads

"As a group of writers and creators who value our own work, and that of others in our field, the editorial staff of IGN takes plagiarism very seriously. In light of concerns that have been raised about our dead cells review, we've removed it for the time being and are investigating."
so as of right now that is where we are
and it''ll be very interesting to see what IGN does here
should they investigate, they come back,they have to say essentially one of two things
one: we also agree and think that it is plagiarism
or no we think this is a case of close parallel thinking
or two: depending on whats happening with their investigation, is Filip still hired, is he suspended, or is he fired?
with that said, I do want to pass the question on to you, what are your thoughts here?
could it be too close for it to not be plagiarism? could it just be parallel thinking?
could the reviewer have maybe seen this video, and just the order was stuck in their head?
or is that too giving? any and all opinions, I'd love to know your thoughts here.
and then let's talk about  these wild fires in California.
so last week on the PDS we talked about how this was the worst California wild fires season since 2008
and since then the situation has gotten worse, in fact so bad that reportedly
there are now 14000 fire fighters in the state assigned to fighting the fires
last week the largest fire was the Carr wild fire
and since then it has grown
reportedly it has burned 163,000 acres and it is 45% contained
according to reports over one thousand structures have been destroyed and eight people have been killed
as far as how this fire started?
investigators are saying they figured out that the fire started when a trailer's tire blew out
and the ram hit the pavement causing a spark.
and that's just insane to think how random that is
but in addition to Carr fire, we should also talk about the Mendocino Complex Fire
which has blown up and doubled in size
this specific complex fire is made up of two smaller fires
the ranch fire, and the river fire
both started on july 27th, they're relatively small
as of right now the cause is unknown
but since Friday the fire has burned through over 290,000 acres
which as of right now makes it the biggest wild fire in California history, beating last years Thomas Fire
positives here: and i use that word very loosely..
luckily because the fire is in a remote area of northern California, there have been no injuries
as of right now only 75 residencies have been destroyed
but that being said fire fighters are still urging people to not underestimate how dangerous this fire is
when those acreage numbers get so large, it's just sometimes hard to imagine what that looks like
to give you context for how massive this fire is
it has burnt 454 square miles
that is about the same size as San Antonio
Its 9 San Fransico's
and as of right now the fire is only 30% contained and is still growing
and on top of all that you have new fire, that started yesterday called the Holy Fire
and this fire is located in orange county, it reportedly started in the Cleveland National Forest
as of recording this video it has burned through 4,000 acres, 0% percent contained
slightly positive news is as of right now it is in a remote area
but the bad news is fire fighters are obviously worried
because the fire could potentially grow and threaten 11 thousand homes in the area
because reportedly that area hasn't burned since 1980
and if turns out that's accurate
that could mean that there is under brush from over three decades to just build this fire
and The Holy Fire and the under brush situation actually connects us to President Trump
and that's because since yesterday Donald Trump has been tweeting about these fires
and some of the tweets it appears that President Trump is getting things wrong
and in other tweets he is getting it right
and we'll actually start on the important note that Donald Trump hits on
after several tweets he tweeted : Must also tree clear to stop fire from spreading
that hits on something both California, and the federal government has been criticized for
there lack of tree clearing
the cutting down and removing of dead trees in a given area
throughout the state there are concerns that fires will continue to grow and get bigger for at least a bit
and that's connected to something that we've been shown since the last two fire seasons
they have been the worst on record
because they followed a five year drought that killed 129 million tree's
and unlike normal under brush, dead dry trees burn far longer and far hotter
so it makes the fires worse, there harder to put out, more lives are put in danger
Trumps proposal here is actually one of the first things that fire experts suggest when talking about how to prevent fires
unfortunately its often either not done efficiently or quickly enough
So I think its incredibly important that we point out President Trumps very valid statement here
and hopefully the government does something about it
but in addition to that Pres.Trump also tweeted out something that seems like he's confusing two situations

if you didn't see on Monday Trump tweeted: Gov Jerry Brown must allow the free flow of the vast amounts of water coming from the North and foolishly being diverted into the Pacific Ocean. Can be used for fires, farming, and everything else. Think of California with plenty of water, nice. Fast Federal Gov. approvals.

and then on monday also saying: California wildfires are being magnified and made so much worse by the bad environmental laws which aren't allowing massive amount of readily available water to be properly utilized. It is being diverted into the Pacific Ocean. Must also tree clear to stop fire from spreading.
and very quickly after that first tweet Pres Trump received a lot criticism
the los angles times putting out an article with the headline
In a strikingly ignorant tweet, Trump gets almost everything about California wild fires wrong
with the N.Y.T. writing Trump inaccurately claims California is wasting water as fires burn
so what is Donald Trump talking about and how is he wrong?
The thing is he's actually right and wrong
as far as how he is right
California farmers for years have been asking for the river water to be diverted
saying rather than having the water be wasted, and being sent straight into the oceans have it be diverted it into their fields.
like many coastal areas in the world, California's rivers flow in to the sea
but environmental groups say that diverting the rivers actually destroy the rivers ecosystem.
and there for example  the state salmon fisheries have all nearly been destroyed
but where trump seems to get things wrong is he's confusing that situation with the reason why the fires are getting worse
seemingly trying to connect the two situations to make it seem like theirs not enough water to fight the fire
and on this note hydrologist Peter Gleick went on twitter to say:

"#Water in California rivers isnt being 'diverted' into the Pacific Ocean. It all used to flow there. What little California Water reaches the sea now is all that's left after farms and cities have diverted most it out of rivers."
Adding "the idea that somehow state water policies are leading to shortage of water for fighting the fires is too stupid to rebut."
and on this note experts have pointed out that water used to fight fires doesn't come from rivers, but rather man made reservoirs and lakes.
as far as: is there enough?
Cal-Fires Assistant Deputy Director Daniel Berlin responded to trumps tweet saying:
"we have plenty of water to fight these wild fires but lets be clear: it's our changing climate that is leading to more severe and destructive fires
and so i guess to kind of consolidate this part of the story
clearing dead trees good
accurate, should be a thing that is done
and as far the other parts of it, it's an all over the place misrepresentation of the situation.
and now you know
and where I wanted to end this story is one thank you to the firefighters putting themselves on the line
trying to keep people safe
and two just a reminder , if you are in an area affected, or possibly affected, please listen to officials
if they say get out or stay away: do that
and that's where I'm going to end today's show
and of course remember this the Philip Defranco Show
I give you the news and sometimes my opinion and then I want to hear from you
whether its the first story or the last story, anything in between.
we're not going to agree on everything but I think that's the point
That being said my name is Philip Defranco, you've just been phil'd in, I love your faces and I'll see you tomorrow.
